===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|なずな|yomi=kun}}
{{IPAchar|/nad͡zuna/}} > {{IPAchar|/nazuna/}}

Unclear. There are two leading theories, based on older form ''nadzuna'':
* May be derived from ''natsu na'', as in {{m|ja|夏|tr=natsu||summer}} + {{m|ja|無|tr=na||missing, gone}}, from the way the plant dies back in the summer.
* May be derived from ''nadzuru na'', as in {{m|ja|撫づる|tr=nadzuru||to pet, to pat, to stroke|pos=the {{m|ja|連体形|tr=rentaikei||attributive form}} of {{etyl|ojp|-}} verb {{m|ja|撫づ}} ''nadzu'', modern {{etyl|ja|-}} {{m|ja|撫でる}} ''naderu''}} + {{m|ja|菜|tr=na||edible greens}}, from the way the flower clusters may invite handling.
